metadata.title: CVE-2022-0433 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's BPFsubsystem in the way a user triggers the map_get_next_key function of theBPF bloom filter. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system. Thisflaw affects Linux kernel versions prior to 5.17-rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.6').
linux-azure package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.4').
linux-gcp package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.6').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.4').
linux-raspi package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
